item.title: Google’s Schmidt quits Apple board
item.description: Google chief executive resigns from Apple’s board of directors after three years as rivalry between the two Silicon Valley companies intensifies

item.title: Wall Street rally boosted by financials
item.description: US equities were trading higher and the S&P 500 was flirting with a key threshold, boosted by improving economic data and a global rally in banking shares

item.title: HSBC profits halve to $5bn
item.description: Profits at HSBC dropped more than 50% to $5bn but earnings from investment banking doubled in the first six months of the year to a record $6.3bn

item.title: Barclays ahead 8% at halfway
item.description: Strong performance of Barclays Capital offset by weakness in UK retail banking, where pre-tax profit fell 61%, and Barclays Commercial Bank, where profit fell 42%

item.title: Ahmadi-Nejad endorsed for second term
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s supreme leader, has formally endorsed Mahmoud Ahmadi-Nejad as president in spite of continuing controversy over his disputed June 12 re-election for a second term

item.title: Japan wages post record fall in June
item.description: Japanese wage earners’ total cash earnings tumbled 7.1 per cent in the year to June, the biggest annual drop on record, suggesting deflation may accelerate as companies curb payments to employees

item.title: White sugar breaks 25-year high
item.description: India’s sugar crop stayed under threat, leading to expectations the world’s largest consumer of the sweetener will turn to imports, sending prices over the $500 a tonne mark

item.title: Canada extradites German arms lobbyist
item.description: A controversial arms lobbyist’s 10-year bid to avoid extradition from Canada ended when Karlheinz Schreiber arrived in his native German to face charges of tax evasion, bribery and fraud

item.title: Recovery at risk from oil price rise
item.description: The world economy cannot sustain any further rise in the oil price, the International Energy Agency’s chief economist warned as prices rose toward a year high

item.title: Wall Street profits from trades with Fed
item.description: Wall Street banks are reaping outsized profits by trading with the Federal Reserve, raising questions about whether the central bank is driving hard enough bargains in its dealings with private sector counterparties, officials and industry executives say
